availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
The State of Kentucky
County of Jefferson

This day William McKinzie (Enjineer of the United States Navy) made oath before me that on the 25th day of February 1865 in the City of Louisville Ky, a felony was committed by the felonious stealing and carrying away from the person and pocket of the offiant, (Wm McKinzie) six fifty dunited states Treasury note of which were compound wi notes and the other a fifty dollar Treasury note worth fifty dollars Each amounting in all to the sum of three hundred dollars in money, and one twenty dollar gold piece, also a diamond cluster ring with six setts worth $1500,00 and that he has good grounds to suspect and verily believes that William Krochehane alias George A Miller, alias William Ashton has been guilty of the crime of feloniously stealing and carrying away from the said Wm McKenzie the aforesaid money and property, and that the said William Krochahone alias George A Miller, alias William Ashton is now a fugitive from Justice at larg in the state of
and thus this affidavit is made for the purpose of geting a requisition for him from the Govenor of said state Kentucky to of the Governor of the state of
Subscribed and sworn to before me by William McKenzie the 27th day of Feb 1865
Jos Clement Justice of the peace Jeff Coty

Requisition
affidavit for
Requisition
issued
5th May 1865
